edu.cpp.cs.cs141.gp

Class Enemy

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.gp.ActiveAgent
      • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.gp.Enemy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Enemy
extends ActiveAgent
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class represents the enemies, the ninjas, who attempt to kill the user, and follow the user if the game is being played in hard mode. It extends the abstract class ActiveAgent. The enemy may be killed as well, by the user with a bullet.
    Author:
    Pink Panthers
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • canStab

        private boolean canStab
        This field represents the enemy's ability to stab the player, which depends on whether the player is in an adjacent square. It is found in the Enemy(), checkPlayer(int, int), and getStab() methods.

      • isDead

        private boolean isDead
        This field represents the enemy's value of whether it has been killed or not. All enemies begin as not dead in the Enemy() constructor, which can be changed in the dies() class. The value can be retrieved in getDeathVal().

      • pursuitMode

        private boolean pursuitMode
        When the game is set to hard mode, the enemy can switch into pursuit mode, during which it will follow the player. It can be changed in the findPlayer(int, int, int, int) method and can be retrieved in getMode().

      • frontDirection

        private int frontDirection
        This field represents the direction that the enemy was in so that the randomized createMoveLocation() method could be skipped, and we can select directly where the enemy is going to move. When in hard mode, the GameEngine essentially uses it in such a way: Enemy.checkDirection(frontDirection). The frontDirection is saved after the enemy finds the player within two adjacent squares in findPlayer(int, int, int, int).

      • spawnRow

        private int spawnRow
        This field represents the row that the Enemy is spawned into, used in spawnEnemy().

      • spawnCol

        private int spawnCol
        This field represents the column that the Enemy is spawned into, used in spawnEnemy().

    • Constructor Detail

      • Enemy

        public Enemy()
        This is the constructor. The first is just temporary, as the actual positions will be randomly generated. The booleans are defaulted at false, and the frontDirection at 1.

    • Method Detail

      • spawnPossibleLocation

        public void spawnPossibleLocation()
        This method randomly creates locations in which the enemy may be spawned at. The row must be in [0, 6), whereas the column must be [3, 9), in other words, the enemy must spawn three squares away from the Player's original spawning point. It calls the ActiveAgent.setPossibleRC(int, int).

      • spawnEnemy

        public void spawnEnemy()
        This method actually places the enemies in their spawn point, with the spawnRow saving ActiveAgent.getPossibleRow() and spawnCol saving ActiveAgent.getPossibleCol(). The official positions are saved with the ActiveAgent.setPosition(int, int) method.

      • checkPlayer

        public void checkPlayer(int playerRow,
                        int playerCol)
        This method checks all four directly adjacent squares for the player and changes canStab to true if the player is indeed in one of the adjacent squares.
        Parameters:
        playerRow - is used to check adjacent positions directly north/up and south/down of the enemy.
        playerCol - is used to check adjacent positions directly east/right and west/left of the enemy.

      • resetStab

        public void resetStab()
        This method resets the canStab boolean to false.

      • createMoveLocation

        public void createMoveLocation()
        This method randomly selects the enemy's direction and sends it as the argument to ActiveAgent.checkDirection(int).

      • findPlayer

        public void findPlayer(int playerRow,
                       int playerCol,
                       int playerOldRow,
                       int playerOldCol)
        The enemy will check two squares around it, trying to find if the player is contained within one of those squares or was previously in that square. If either of those are right, then pursuitMode is turned on, and the frontDirection is set to the appropriate value, which will then be used in the GameEngine's enemyMove(int) method to directly move the enemy. Consequently, the enemy will follow the player until the line of sight is broken. As it is, the LoS can only be broken with turns around rooms and if the player is being followed by multiple enemies. The purpose of checking the previous coordinates of the player is that the LoS is broken way too easily for it to be considered hard at all had this method only checked for the player's current position.
        Parameters:
        playerRow - is used to check the player's row position is close to that of the enemy
        playerCol - is used to check if the player's column position is close to the enemy's
        playerOldRow - is used to check if the player's previous row is close to that of the enemy.
        playerOldCol - is used to check if the player's previous column is close to the enemy's

      • dies

        public void dies()
        This method sets the isDead value to true when the enemy has been shot by the player.

      • getDeathVal

        public boolean getDeathVal()
        This method simply returns the isDead value, which determines whether any movement or actions whatsoever will come from this particular entity.
        Returns:
        isDead

      • getStab

        public boolean getStab()
        This method simply returns the canStab value, which will either kill the player (if it is true) or not (if it is false).
        Returns:
        canStab

      • getMode

        public boolean getMode()
        This method simply returns the pursuitMode value, which will determine whether the enemy will follow (if true) or not (if false).
        Returns:
        pursuitMode

      • getFrontDirection

        public int getFrontDirection()
        This method simply returns the frontDirection integer, which determines which direction the enemy will move in. This is specifically used to directly move the enemy in the case that pursuitMode is true.
        Returns:
        frontDirection

      • getSpawnRow

        public int getSpawnRow()
        This method simply returns the spawnRow of the enemy.
        Returns:
        spawnRow

      • getSpawnCol

        public int getSpawnCol()
        This method simply returns the spawnCol of the enemy.
        Returns:
        spawnCol
